qas.question: Who invented the term "urban adult contemporary format"?
What demographic group is the urban adult contemporary format marketed to?
What style of singing is absent from R&B played on urban adult contemporary format stations?
Along with R&B, gospel and dance music, what type of music is represented on urban adult contemporary stations?
Urban adult contemporary music came into being because of pressure on what previously existing format?

context: In response to the pressure on <a4_0>Hot AC<a4_0/>, a new kind of AC format cropped up among American radio recently. The urban adult contemporary format (a term coined by <a0_0>Barry Mayo<a0_0/>) usually attracts a large number of <a1_0>African Americans<a1_0/> and sometimes Caucasian listeners through playing a great deal of R&B (without any form of <a2_0>rapping<a2_0/>), gospel music, <a3_0>classic soul<a3_0/> and dance music (including disco).
